shows.name: An Evening With The Guys From Mystery Science Theater 3000
shows.bio:
Legendary cult TV show Mystery Science Theater 3000 is back with all-new episodes streaming on Netflix, and here to screen their favorite of the new season are Satellite of Love crew members Jonah Ray, who plays Jonah Heston, Hampton Yount, voice of Crow T. Robot, and Baron Vaughn, voice of Tom Servo. The Bridgetown Comedy Festival is pleased to present standup comedy from these hilarious three, along with an episode viewing and audience Q&A immediately following.

This show is ticketed separately via Revolution Hall. Golden Ticket passes INCLUDE admission to this show, while standard passes do not. Tickets are on sale at http://www.revolutionhall.com/event/1468354-evening-guys-from-mystery-po...
shows.copy:

shows.name: Audible Presents Hold On with Eugene Mirman
shows.bio: Storytelling aficionado and inquisitive host Eugene Mirman (Bob’s Burgers) sits down with special guests and pauses their true, entertaining, and personal stories to get the funny details they might have left out. Listen now in Audible Channels!
shows.copy: Storytelling aficionado and inquisitive host Eugene Mirman (Bob’s Burgers) sits down with special guests and pauses their true, entertaining, and personal stories to get the funny details they might have left out. Listen now in Audible Channels!

shows.name: Andy Kindler's Particular Show
shows.copy:
Andy chooses from his rolodex (Rolex?) of comedy superstars from LA and around the world (New York) to present a hilarious (his words) and very Particular show. Andy’s the host. It’s his party and he will do time in between each comic if he wants to.

Andy Kindler was a frequent guest on The Late Show with David Letterman with over 40 appearances. He currently recurs on IFC’s Maron, Comedy Central’s Tosh.O and is Mort the Mortician on Fox’s hit animation show Bob’s Burgers.

shows.name: The Goddamn Comedy Jam
shows.bio:
Stand-up comedian Josh Adam Meyers along with the Goddamn Band, host the premiere comedy event: The Goddamn Comedy Jam (#GDCJ). A killer lineup of comedic entertainers come together to rock the stage and the mic in the only show that proves: every comedian wants to be a rock star.

The Goddamn Comedy Jam is the intersection of comedy stardom and rock & roll dreams. Comedians perform a stand up set and short story followed by a song of their choosing, accompanied by a live band. It is an unprecedented opportunity to shine as both a comedic star and rock God in the electrified atmosphere that can only be found at The Goddamn Comedy Jam.

This show is a separately ticketed even at Crystal Ballroom on Thursday, May 4th. Tickets are on sale at http://www.crystalballroompdx.com/events/168154-The-Goddamn-Comedy-Jam

THE COMEDY JAM premiered on Comedy Central March 22.
shows.copy:
Stand-up comedian Josh Adam Meyers along with the Goddamn Band, host the premier comedy event: The Goddamn Comedy Jam (#GDCJ). A killer lineup of comedic entertainers come together to rock the stage and the mic in the only show that proves: every comedian wants to be a rock star.

The Goddamn Comedy Jam is the intersection of comedy stardom and rock & roll dreams. Comedians perform a stand up set and short story followed by a song of their choosing, accompanied by a live band. It is an unprecedented opportunity to shine as both a comedic star and rock god in the electrified atmosphere that can only be found at The Goddamn Comedy Jam.

This show is a separately ticketed event taking place at Crystal Ballroom on Thursday, May 4th. Tickets are on sale at http://www.crystalballroompdx.com/events/168154-The-Goddamn-Comedy-Jam

THE COMEDY JAM premieres on Comedy Central March 22.

shows.name: Reunited!
shows.bio:
Reunited! brings together the casts of beloved sitcoms for in-depth panel discussions, Q & A sessions, and table-reads of classic scenes.

 

The catch? The shows never existed, except in the minds of hosts/show-creators Josh Androsky and Bryan Cook.  Additionally, none of the guests have any prior knowledge of the series they “starred” on.

 

Cook and Androsky create a fictionalized world where a panel of comics discuss personal issues, professional pitfalls, and brushes with the law. It would be the most scandalous show in Hollywood if any of it had ever happened.
shows.copy:

shows.name: The Jackie and Laurie Show
shows.bio: The Jackie and Laurie Show stars two women in comedy, Jackie Kashian and Laurie Kilmartin, talking about women and comedy. No guests, just two headliners who started in the 80s and never stopped.
shows.copy: The Jackie and Laurie Show stars two women in comedy, Jackie Kashian and Laurie Kilmartin, talking about women and comedy. No guests, just two headliners who started in the 80s and never stopped.

shows.name: Lance Bangs Presents Come Laugh With Us
shows.bio:
Featuring special guests Kyle Kinane, Janeane Garofalo, Baron Vaughn, Karen Kilgariff, Ron Lynch, April Richardson, Jesse Elias, Brodie Reed, rare footage from Lance and live music from Team Dresch!

 

Lance Bangs is a Pacific Northwest institution, and a legend in the worlds of music and comedy. As a filmmaker and music video director he’s created videos for Sonic Youth, Nirvana, Neutral Milk Hotel, Green Day, Arcade Fire, The Shins, The Thermals, Belle & Sebastian, Menomena, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, R.E.M., Mike Watt, Death Cab for Cutie, The Black Keys, Kanye West, Odd Future, and Pavement. He has directed comedy specials for Hannibal Burress, Chelsea Peretti, Marc Maron, Kyle Kinane, Jen Kirkman, and David Cross, and he’s been heavily involved in the filming and production of MTV's Jackass television series and it’s subsequent movies. He helped build the international television network Viceland, where his comedy series Flophouse and Party Legends currently air.

 

With a body of work like that, Lance has an incredible catalog of rarely-seen footage, and for years he’s combined screenings of these gems from his personal library with top-notch standup comedy from the biggest names in the Bridgetown Comedy Festival in his show Come Laugh With Us. This is a can’t-miss night of rarities and special guest performances!
shows.copy:
Featuring special guests Kyle Kinane, Janeane Garofalo, Baron Vaughn, Karen Kilgariff, Ron Lynch, April Richardson, Jesse Elias, Brodie Reed, rare footage from Lance and live music from Team Dresch!

 

Lance Bangs is a Pacific Northwest institution, and a legend in the worlds of music and comedy. As a filmmaker and music video director he’s created videos for Sonic Youth, Nirvana, Neutral Milk Hotel, Green Day, Arcade Fire, The Shins, The Thermals, Belle & Sebastian, Menomena, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, R.E.M., Mike Watt, Death Cab for Cutie, The Black Keys, Kanye West, Odd Future, and Pavement. He has directed comedy specials for Hannibal Burress, Chelsea Peretti, Marc Maron, Kyle Kinane, Jen Kirkman, and David Cross, and he’s been heavily involved in the filming and production of MTV's Jackass television series and it’s subsequent movies. He helped build the international television network Viceland, where his comedy series Flophouse and Party Legends currently air.

 

With a body of work like that, Lance has an incredible catalog of rarely-seen footage, and for years he’s combined screenings of these gems from his personal library with top-notch standup comedy from the biggest names in the Bridgetown Comedy Festival in his show Come Laugh With Us. This is a can’t-miss night of rarities and special guest performances!

 

Note that this show is ticketed separately via Revolution Hall, and that standard festival passes do not grant admission, but Golden Tickets do. Tickets available at http://www.revolutionhall.com/event/1468352-lance-bangs-come-laugh-us-portland/

shows.name: Guy Branum's Gay Bash
shows.bio: Join Guy Branum (Talk Show The Game Show, The Mindy Project) as he puts his gayest foot forward to bring you his favourite cavalcade of merry men and women.
shows.copy: Join Guy Branum (Talk Show The Game Show, The Mindy Project) as he puts his gayest foot forward to bring you his favourite cavalcade of merry men and women.

shows.name: Can I Pet Your Dog? Podcast
shows.bio: Hey Guys! We're a podcast on Max Fun, with a groundbreaking take on dogs. We cover it all! Dogs We Met This Week, Stupid Dog Tech, Dog News, Dog Heroes... you name it, we're covering it. We also interview guests! We keep the conversation strictly to dog stories, if they want to discuss their latest projects, there's the door.
shows.copy: Maximum Fun Network's Comedy Podcast about dogs. You like dogs? You like podcasts? Well then you're gonna lose your mind over this show, it's got BOTH OF THOSE THINGS!

shows.name: A Good Trip with Shane Mauss
shows.bio:
Shane Mauss Presents

A GOOD TRIP

Comedian Shane Mauss has appeared on Conan, Jimmy Kimmel, Showtime, and has specials on both Comedy Central and Netflix, and interviews scientists for the podcast Here We Are.  Now he is touring around the country on a 100+ city tour with comedy show about psychedelics.  Part stand-up, part storytelling, and part Ted Talk combine for one of the most unique, informative, and funny comedy shows you will ever see.  (No psychedelic experience required)

The show has been heard about on This comedy show about psychedelics has been heard about on Marc Maron's WTF, Pete Holmes' You Made It Weird, The Duncan Trussell Family Hour, The Joe Rogan Experience, Bertcast, Ari Shaffir's Skeptic Tank, Cracked Podcast, Put Your Hands Together, Doug Loves Movies, and more.

This tour is sponsored by The Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS)
shows.copy:
Shane Mauss Presents

A GOOD TRIP

Comedian Shane Mauss has appeared on Conan, Jimmy Kimmel, and Showtime. He has specials on both Comedy Central and Netflix, and he interviews scientists for the podcast Here We Are.  Now he is touring around the country on a 100+ city tour with comedy show about psychedelics.  Part stand-up, part storytelling, and part Ted Talk combine for one of the most unique, informative, and funny comedy shows you will ever see.  (No psychedelic experience required)

The show has been featured on Marc Maron's WTF, Pete Holmes' You Made It Weird, The Duncan Trussell Family Hour, The Joe Rogan Experience, Bertcast, Ari Shaffir's Skeptic Tank, Cracked Podcast, Put Your Hands Together, Doug Loves Movies, and more.

shows.name: All Fantasy Everything
shows.bio: Ian Karmel hosts a show where funny people and experts come together to fantasy draft pop culture, from music to movies to sandwiches, everything is in play.
shows.copy: Ian Karmel hosts a show where funny people and experts come together to fantasy draft pop culture, from music to movies to sandwiches, everything is in play.

shows.name: Audible Presents The Guest List
shows.bio: THE GUEST LIST is a stand-up comedy showcase presented by and recorded for Audible. Based in San Francisco, this showcase is produced all over town - secret speakeasies, hidden clubs and in the basements of the best comedy clubs. You’ve got to be on the guest list to get into THE GUEST LIST and for the first time, the show leaves SF and comes north for Bridgetown! Festival badge-holders will be our guests of honor in what will be a killer lineup of comics from around the country.
shows.copy: THE GUEST LIST is a stand-up comedy showcase presented by and recorded for Audible. Based in San Francisco, this showcase is produced all over town - secret speakeasies, hidden clubs and in the basements of the best comedy clubs. You’ve got to be on the guest list to get into THE GUEST LIST and for the first time, the show leaves SF and comes north for Bridgetown! Festival badge-holders will be our guests of honor in what will be a killer lineup of comics from around the country.

shows.name: Picture This!
shows.bio:
You guys know about Picture This! since it's been used as a reference for show submissions for the last few years. But the show has grown and refined in the last 4 years since we did the show at Bridgetown. We would love a chance to come back to Bridgetown like some of the other theme shows like Competitive Erotic Fan Fiction as our show is 100% unique every time we put the show on based on new comedian and animator mixes. We also had a PDX franchise of the show (ended at the end of 2015) so we have a strong base of animators and fans of the show that we would bring to the festival if we were doing a show for the festival. Brandie, Mike, Mike and I would really love to bring the live animated comedy sensation that Tig Notaro, the SF Sketchfest crew, the RIOT LA crew, the BoJack Horseman creators and more have enjoyed enough to bring them to their festivals and brands. Below is the rest of the updated info on the show:

Picture This! has been going on monthly for over 5 years in Los Angeles with both the regular monthly show and special sponsored shows with sponsors like Bento Box Entertainment, Comedy Central’s Brickleberry, Adult Swim’s Mr. Pickles, Netflix’s BoJack Horseman, Cartoon Network and more! The show also has franchised monthly shows in New York, San Francisco and Portland. The show has also debuted in Washington DC at the Kennedy Center, Denver, New Orleans, Indiana, Iowa, Toronto, New Zealand and the following festivals:

2013 Adelaide Fringe Festival
2013 Melbourne International Comedy Festival
2013 Bridgetown Comedy Festival
2014 San Francisco Sketchfest
2014 All Jane No Dick Comedy Festival
2015 Green Gravel Comedy Festial
2015 CROM Comedy Festival Denver
2015 Animation Block Party Festival
2015 Hell Yeah Fest
2015 New York Comedy Festival
2016 RIOT LA Comedy Festival
2016 SF Sketchfest
2016 Limestone Comedy Festival
2016 Animation Block Party Festival
2016 High Plains Comedy Festival
2016 Tig Notaro’s Bentzen Ball
2017 SF Sketchfest
shows.copy:
PICTURE THIS! is a new show from Brandie Posey & Sam Varela: two girls who want to push the boundaries of what a comedy show can be. Picture This! is a live comedy show with stand-ups, voice actors and more performing while they are drawn live by some of the best animators, cartoonists, and other artists in the biz! The comedians don’t know what the animators are drawing and the animators don’t know how the comedians will react.

It may be weird.

It may different.

But it will be FUNNY!

shows.name: The New Negroes
shows.bio: "New Negro" is a term popularized during the Harlem Renaissance to imply an outspoken intellectual departure from long-standing racist ideology and institutions. In 2016, many long-standing institutions are being called out for racist ideologies. We are just over here doing it with sillinesses and jokisms. Join Baron Vaughn as he hosts comedians departing from what you might think "Black" is supposed to be. So sit back and enjoy while we welcome you…to the New Negroes.

shows.name: Competitive Erotic Fan Fiction with Bryan Cook
shows.bio: Competitive Erotic Fan Fiction with Bryan Cook is a live show and popular podcast on the Nerdist Network. It has been recognized as one of the top shows in LA by LA Weekly and listed in the Top 20 Comedy Podcasts by Rolling Stone. The LA show, held every month at the Virgil, recently celebrated its third anniversary. Each show features two rounds of comics, writing and performing Erotic Fan Fiction pieces, based upon their whims or audience suggestions. It’s really stupid.

It’s really stupid.

shows.name: The Dork Forest
shows.bio: Jackie Kashian discusses favorite obsessions with the obsessed. Video games, Comic Books, Birdwatching. How deep in the dork forest are you? Celebrate it and f*&%$, make it your own!
shows.copy: Jackie Kashian discusses favorite obsessions with the obsessed. Video games, Comic Books, Birdwatching. How deep in the dork forest are you? Celebrate it and f*&%$, make it your own!

shows.name: Probably Science
shows.bio: Comedians whose bachelors degrees in STEM fields are currently gathering dust take you through the week in science. Incompetently. Featuring Matt Kirshen, Andy Wood, sometimes Jesse Case, sometimes Brooks Wheelan and special guests from the word of comedy, and occasionally science.
shows.copy: Comedians whose bachelors degrees in STEM fields are currently gathering dust take you through the week in science. Incompetently. Featuring Matt Kirshen, Andy Wood, sometimes Jesse Case, sometimes Brooks Wheelan and special guests from the word of comedy, and occasionally science.

shows.name: Turnt Up with Eliza Skinner
shows.bio: Comedians face off in series of one-on-one rap battles -- totally freestyle, totally improvised. The audience decides the winner by applause at the end of every round, until we have one final champion. It's like 8 Mile, but funny. Past competitors include Reggie Watts, TJ Miller, Childish Gambino, Thomas Middleditch, Pete Holmes, MC Chris, Nicole Parker, Megan Amram, and like a billion other people. Hosted by Eliza Skinner.
shows.copy: Comedians face off in series of one-on-one rap battles -- totally freestyle, totally improvised. The audience decides the winner by applause at the end of every round, until we have one final champion. It's like 8 Mile, but funny. shows.name: Brew Haha: The Comedy Show Drinking Game
shows.bio:
Brew HaHa: The Comedy Show Drinking Game is an interactive stand-up comedy show featuring two simultaneous drinking games, one for the audience and one for the comics. For the comics, each comic drinks one full drink for every set preceding theirs (ex, if a comic goes 4th, they will have three drinks before their set). At the beginning of their set, each comic will chug for the amount of rules broken by the comic before them (ex. If comic #2 breaks 6 rules, comic #3 drinks for 6 seconds). For the audience, we create rules that go along with stand up comedy. Every time a comic breaks a rule, a drink sign lights up and the audience takes a sip. It's hilarious and freaks the comics out.
We've been running Brew for almost four years, and have loved every second of it. We get about 300 people to our backyard each month for the show, have brought it to a number of comedy festivals (Bridgetown, RiotLA, JashFesht), and in 2016 made a Brew Haha pilot for MTV!
shows.copy: One part comedy show, two parts drinking game, Brew Haha is a hilarious interactive mix of standup comedy and your favorite pre- party ritual. At the beginning of every show, the hosts introduce the crowd to a set of rules created specifically for that show. When comics, unbeknownst to them, break a rule, the audience drinks. A giant light-up “drink” sign will help you play along. A second game, specifically for the performers, ensures that as the audience gets toastier, so do the comedians. Come experience the show that a super famous comedian once called "the worst idea for a show ever."

shows.name: Earthquake Hurricane
shows.bio:
Earthquake Hurricane is Portland's comedy super-group comprised of Bri Pruett, Alex Falcone, Katie Nguyen, and Anthony Lopez. We stand out from the crowded Portland comedy scene because of our group hosting. We open and close the show with a discussion of the biggest (and smallest) issues of the day, riffing with each other and our audience. In addition to being consistently ranked as some of the best comics in the city, we also have more than two decades of combined improv experience.

We're also known around Portland for being the toughest showcase to get on, as our lineups are the most consistently strong of any show. Comics tell us they knew they were going to have a future in comedy the first time they got asked to do our show.
shows.copy:
Named Willamette Week's "Best comedy show in Portland," Earthquake Hurricane is Portland's comedy super-group comprised of Bri Pruett, Alex Falcone, Katie Nguyen, and Anthony Lopez. 
We feature sets from the best comics in town and from around the world, plus a group dynamic that is unrivaled. Paste Magazine says, "The magic of EQH is in the hosts" and we would never argue with Paste Magazine.

shows.name: Rants Off/ Dance Off
shows.bio:
Rants Off / Dance Off is a comedy game show where comedians compete in a battle of vulnerabilities both verbal and physical! Contestants offer their heated opinions on subjects--some prepared, some improvised--and then, like ice cream to a hot pepper so foolishly eaten whole, sooth their raw nerves by dancing their hearts out. Judgement is summarily doled out panel-style. Winners receive little but pride and regrets. Great fun is had by all!

Rants Off / Dance Off has been a part of Bridgetown, All Jane Comedy Festival, and Bumbershoot. Hosted by Whitney Streed with musical direction by Manuel Hall.
shows.copy: Rants Off / Dance Off is a comedy game show where comedians compete in a battle of vulnerabilities both verbal and physical! Contestants offer their heated opinions on subjects--some prepared, some improvised--and then, like ice cream to a hot pepper so foolishly eaten whole, sooth their raw nerves by dancing their hearts out. Judgement is summarily doled out panel-style. Winners receive little but pride and regrets. Great fun is had by all! Rants Off / Dance Off has been featured at Bridgetown, All Jane Comedy Festival, and Bumbershoot. Hosted by Whitney Streed with musical direction by by Manuel Hall.

shows.name: Here We Are Podcast
shows.bio:
Here We Are – Live! 

Each week on the Here We Are Podcast stand-up comedian Shane Mauss travels the country interviewing scientists about their work and the meanings of life.  Shane uses his non-academic, “every-man” approach to learn about some of the most important research and ideas about life in a highly accessible, funny, and interesting way.  Listeners get to eavesdrop on Shane’s journey to figure out why we are here, why we behave the way we do, and what to do about it.  The aim is to look at life in as many different ways as possible to better understand ourselves and have a few laughs along the way.

In special live episodes, we better connect scientists to the public in fun ways.  It gives audiences an opportunity to have a more unique live entertainment experience and ask scientists questions of their own.  This is not a pretentious event.  This is a very fun and casual setting where people of all ages and backgrounds are invited to have some drinks, learn, laugh, and meet other intellectually curious people in the area.
shows.copy:
Here We Are – Live! 

Each week on the Here We Are Podcast stand-up comedian Shane Mauss travels the country interviewing scientists about their work and the meaning of life.  Shane uses his non-academic, “every-man” approach to learn about some of the most important research and ideas about life in a highly accessible, funny, and interesting way.  Listeners get to eavesdrop on Shane’s journey to figure out why we are here, why we behave the way we do, and what to do about it.  The aim is to look at life in as many different ways as possible to better understand ourselves and have a few laughs along the way.

shows.name: Minority Retort
shows.bio:
Minority Retort is one of Portland’s most popular and critically acclaimed comedy shows and celebrates diversity like none other. Hosted by comedian Jeremy Eli and co-produced by writer/radio show host Jason Lamb, Minority Retort's goal is to provide comedians of color with a platform to speak their minds and share their unique perspectives, as well as reach the multicultural comedy audience that exists within the so-called "whitest city in America". Nationally recognized comedians such as Baron Vaughn (Netflix’s Grace & Frankie), Janine Brito (FX’s Totally Biased), Zainab Johnson (HBO) and Maggie Maye (Conan) have performed on the show, as well as many comics frequently featured in Portland's Bridgetown Comedy Festival: Nathan Brannon, Bri Pruett, Elicia Sanchez, Anthony Lopez, Curtis Cook, Adam Pasi, David Mascorro, and Katie Nguyen.

Minority Retort is also a part of XRAY FM radio’s morning show Fridays at 8:40am.

For more info, visit Minority Retort on Facebook or on Twitter at @iMinorityRetort.
shows.copy: Minority Retort is the NW's premier standup showcase featuring comedians of color! Hosted by comedian Jeremy Eli and co-produced by writer/radio show host Jason Lamb, Minority Retort's goal is to provide performers with a platform to speak their minds and share their unique perspectives, as well as reach the multicultural comedy audience that exists within the so-called "whitest city in America".

shows.name: Late Late Breakfast
shows.bio:
Hosted and co-created by lovable scamps Tyler Jackson and Danny Maupin, Late Late Breakfast is a fast-paced mixed-format standup show that audiences across the country have embraced. Brightest Young Things has said, "It's weird and chaotic and fun and silly and smart and everything standup comedy lacks."

Every show is a wildly different experience and features top comedians telling jokes while facing unique themed challenges that could be anything from having an impromptu puppet show or pie fight, to undergoing a lie detector test, giving a guided tour in a trolley car, or pitching in a baseball game involving the entire audience.

Expect anything and everything out of the ordinary, all of it held together by solid, hilarious standup comedy.

Late Late Breakfast has been featured on the New York Comedy Festival, The Comedy Exposition, Crom Comedy Fest, Hell Yes Fest, Accidental Comedy Fest, and many more since its inception in 2013. We are frequently featured as a top comedy show in publications like The Interrobang, The Daily Dot, Time Out, and the Chicago Tribune. We also shot a television pilot in June! This has all helped us develop a streamlined version of our normal show that works incredibly well at festivals!
shows.copy:
Late Late Breakfast is the perfect comedy show for a drunken, weird Saturday afternoon. Hosted and co-created by lovable scamps Tyler Jackson and Danny Maupin, Late Late Breakfast is a fast-paced mixed-format standup show/open mic that the Chicago Reader has simply called "Chaos."

Every show is a wildly different experience and features a dizzying array of comedians telling jokes while facing randomized themed challenges that could be anything from having an impromptu puppet show or pie fight or Easter Pageant, to giving a guided tour in a trolley car or smashing fruit like Gallagher or pitching in a baseball game involving the entire audience.

Expect anything and everything out of the ordinary, all of it held together by solid, hilarious standup comedy.

shows.name: Palindrome Fight
shows.bio:
This show is a real-time palindrome-creation battle modeled after Iron Comic and Iron Chef. Several top comics with palindromic chops have 55 minutes to create one or more original palindromes from an audience suggestion, while the audience hears more traditional comedy sets. Then they vote by applause for the winner. 90 minute show.

Competitors: Myq Kaplan, Zach Sherwin, Dax Jordan, and Mark Saltveit have signed on. All have performed at Bridgetown before and will apply personally.

Kaplan and Saltveit will be competing in Will Shortz' second World Palindrome Championship March 24th and 25th, 2017 in Stamford CT, and Saltveit is the reigning world champion. Dax competed in an Iron Palindromist event in 2012. Sherwin has judged the SymmyS Awards for Palindrome Excellence the last two years.

If the show is accepted, we'll invite Demetri Martin (who has also judged the SymmyS) to participate as well.

There should be considerable hype about palindromes surrounding the second World Palindrome Championship in late March. A documentary film crew is preparing a feature on it. Here is their short: https://vimeo.com/119999700
shows.copy:
WARY, ALPINE ZEN: I PLAY RAW!

The world needs more good palindromes, so we're going to make some -- based on audience suggestions. Top palindromist comedians, including Myq Kaplan (Conan, Letterman, Comedy Central), Zach Sherwin ("Epic Rap Battles of History"), Dax Jordan (Bob and Tom Show) and Mark Saltveit (the reigning World Palindrome Champion), will race to write reversible one-liners, while "straight" comics do more traditional sets. After an hour, the audience will decide the winner.

shows.name: Midnight Ma$$
shows.bio: Midnight Mass is one of Portland's most beloved shows of all time! Alongside renowned pianist and Chicago comedian Ira Novos, Amy Miller hosts a raucous late night showcase that features a diverse range of comedy styles, voices, and drunkenness levels. The show is punctuated with a couple of loosely churchy rituals, like a pre-show greeting/ peace be with you, and confessions from the audience. Midnight Ma$$ has been home to many a storied drop-in, including Norm Macdonald, Rory Scovel, and Dave Attell. MM was voted Best Local Comedy Show in the Willamette Week readers' poll.
shows.copy: Midnight Mass is one of Portland's most beloved shows of all time! Alongside renowned pianist and Chicago comedian Ira Novos, Amy Miller hosts a raucous late night showcase that features a diverse range of comedy styles, voices, and drunkenness levels. The show is punctuated with a couple of loosely churchy rituals, like a pre-show greeting/ peace be with you, and confessions from the audience. Midnight Ma$$ has been home to many a storied drop-in, including Norm Macdonald, Rory Scovel, and Dave Attell. MM was voted Best Local Comedy Show in the Willamette Week readers' poll.

shows.name: Barbara Holm Believes in You
shows.bio: Barbara Holm Believes in You is a quirky, smart, unique, progressive comedy show every first Thursday of the month. The show features some of the funniest comedians nationwide and is hosted by local comic Barbara Holm. With hilarious comedians, prizes and gifts for the crowd, and a genuine atmosphere of friendship, the show is a favorite amongst Portland audiences.
shows.copy: Barbara Holm Believes in You is a quirky, smart, unique, progressive comedy show every first Thursday of the month. The show features some of the funniest comedians nationwide and is hosted by local comic Barbara Holm. With hilarious comedians, prizes and gifts for the crowd, and a genuine atmosphere of friendship, the show is a favorite amongst Portland audiences.

shows.name: No Pun Intendo
shows.bio: Simultaneously one of the best and the absolute WORST comedy shows in Portland, No Pun Intendo happens in the corner bar area of Ground Kontrol. No Pun Intendo has spent the last 6 years giving comedians panic attacks of varying gravity, but it’s the show to see if you really want to see them try. It’s a great challenge for comedians—an exercise in hard consonants, volume control gimmicks, and the confidence to believe the few people gathered around the tables are really really with them. It’s where you can see a comic give everything they have, amidst complete chaos, on one of the longest running shows in town.
shows.copy:
Stand-Up Comics & Stand-Up Games! No Pun Intendo brings fantastic comedians to Ground Kontrol, a bar arcade downtown, and one of Portland’s most wonderful places.! Ground Kontrol also has great nachos, and you can shoot for high scores on all the best old games. Plus we occasionally have video game competitions between audience members with fabulous prizes!
Each month, we feature fantastic comics from Portland & beyond.

shows.name: Control Yourself
shows.bio:
I've been running my stand up showcase, Control Yourself, for 3full years now. Over the years, it's evolved into a weekly show and now every 1st Sunday of the month we record the show live and distribute it as a podcast.  CY has packed out Alberta Street Pub's 85 person venue on a weekly basis, for years. I would be honored to take the show to a larger venue outside of NE PDX and expand CY's reach in the scene. Since its first year running, CY has been named in the 'Top 5 Portland Comedy Showcases' which are voted on by the people. I am super proud of the work put into that stage and carefully hand select comics to create a well rounded perspective of voices. Too often local shows are booked with the same breath of comics stylings, yet at CY, audience members knows there will be a little something for everyone. Control Yourself showcase is a party, we get weird, there's an open mic after the show, the comedy lasts forever, it's always a highlight of at least 100 people's week.

 

Thank you for your consideration!

JoAnn Schinderle
shows.copy:
JoAnn Schinderle (LaughsTV, VICE, Audible) brings an hour of organic laughs, featuring touring headliners (Baron Vaugh, Sara Schaefer and Jared Logan) as well as local up-and-comers. Control Yourself is also a live, recorded podcast that can be found on iTunes, Soundcloud, and is part of the Rivercity Podcast Federation.  

Control Yourself has been highlighted in Paste Magazine, and was named one of the 'Top 5 PDX Comedy Showcases' three years in a row by the Willamette Week. 

"Hosted with exasperated verve by JoAnn Schinderle, the weekly showcase has an intimate basement-party vibe." ~ Matthew Singer, WW 'Top 5 PDX Comedy Showcases 2016'
